areaDesc.2: Level. Principal subdivisions known as Bermuda Tract and Poe's Subdivision.
areaDesc.3: All utilities in; about 80% of streets paved. Good churches, schools, community business center and recreational parks. Good transportation facilities.
areaDesc.4: Lack of zoning restrictions; encroachment of business and industrial. Paving assessments heavy in relation to value of property (those assessments are now in process of adjustment); collections poor. Vandalism bad.
areaDesc.14: *Lenders will lend only on heavily restricted basis.

15.1: Henry C. Hamilton, Pres., Mchugh-Hamilton Realtors, and HOLC contract brokers; also personal inspection by Field Agent.

areaDesc.2: Level. Principal subdivisions known as Bon Air, Part of Fulton Homes, Bascombe Tract (D-2), Wilson's second addition (D-1), Sim's addition (D-1)-whole community known as Oakdale.
areaDesc.3: All utilities in; adequate transportation facilities, schools, and churches in D-1, 2.
areaDesc.4: South end of D-4 has poor transportation facilities and inadequate schools and churches. Only about 25% of streets paved in all three areas. Ice plant, coal yards, feed manufacturing, planting mill and R. R. in D-4. Lack of zoning restrictions. Scattered vandalism.

d.1: None in D-1, scattered in D-2, 4

5.a: Clerical workers, factory workers, skilled mechanics, and laborers

areaDesc.14: *Lenders will lend only on a greatly restricted basis. In D-2 the property located along the northern side of Arlington Street from Washignton Avenue to Ross Street, extending northward to the southern side of Alba Street, on the eastern portion and southern side of Cottrell Street in the western portion of the area is of slightly better character than that of the remainder of the area and should be graded as C grade property.

15.1: Henry C. Hamilton, Pres., Mchugh-Hamilton Realtors, and HOLC contract brokers; also personal inspection by Field Agent.

areaDesc.2: Level. Principal subdivisions known as Bermuda Tract and Poe's Subdivision.
areaDesc.3: All utilities in; about 80% of streets paved. Good churches, schools, community business center and recreational parks. Good transportation facilities.
areaDesc.4: Lack of zoning restrictions; encroachment of business and industrial. Paving assessments heavy in relation to value of property (those assessments are now in process of adjustment); collections poor. Vandalism bad.
areaDesc.14: *Lenders will lend only on heavily restricted basis.

15.1: Henry C. Hamilton, Pres., Mchugh-Hamilton Realtors, and HOLC contract brokers; also personal inspection by Field Agent.

areaDesc.2: Level. Principal subdivisions known as Delacroix Place. Du Broca Tract, West End, Fulton Homes, and Bon Air subdivisions.
areaDesc.3: All utilities in C-6; also community business center in this area.
areaDesc.4: No city sewerage in portion of C-5 which is outside the city limits. About 25% of the streets paved. Outlying portions of C-6 not served by street cars. No zoning. C-6 traversed by railroad.
areaDesc.14: *Lenders will lend only on a restricted basis. In C-6 along both sides of Government Street and the southern side of new Government Street and northern side of Myrtle Street, extending from the southeastern corner of Cherokee and Government Streets, extending westward to the railroad tracks, is located some well-kept, high grade residential property which should be classified as B property.

15.1: Henry C. Hamilton, Pres., Mchugh-Hamilton Realtors, and HOLC contract brokers; also personal inspection by Field Agent.

areaDesc.2: Level. No subdivsion names.
areaDesc.3: All utilities in. Practically all of the streets are paved. Good transportation facilities. Good churches and schools.
areaDesc.4: Broad street is zoned for business. Area adjoins two cemeteries; is traversed by two railroads, the L. &N. on the eastern boundary and the Gulf, Mobile & Northern in center. Slight encroachment of business. Heavy paving assessments now in process of adjustment.
areaDesc.14: N/A

15.1: Henry C. Hamilton, Pres., Mchugh-Hamilton Realtors, and HOLC contract brokers; also personal inspection by Field Agent.

areaDesc.2: Level. Principal subdivision known as Orange Grove (Negro section of city).
areaDesc.3: Negro business community located in the area. Proximity to city and sources of employment.
areaDesc.4: About 10% of streets paved. Lack of zoning restrictions; encroachment of commerical and industrial property. Low percentage of home ownership. Difficulty of collections. Vandalism bad. Age of improvements and dilapidated repair condition of same.
areaDesc.13: Should hold steady from negro tenant standpoint.
areaDesc.14: This area contains considerable property which should be demolished.

15.1: Henry C. Hamilton, Pres., Mchugh-Hamilton Realtors, and HOLC contract brokers; also personal inspection by Field Agent.

areaDesc.2: Level. Principal subdivsion known as Demouy, Bienville, West End, Macy Place, Monterey Place, Reed's and Florence Place subdivisions.
areaDesc.3: All utilities; C-2 all streets paved, C-4 no streets paved. Transportation facilities. Good type of citizens.
areaDesc.4: Zoning ordinance not strictly enforced.

5.a: Mixed: Good salaried workers, business and professional men

areaDesc.14: Old Folks Home (aged and destitute) located in C-2 on McGill Avenue; it is quiet and nicely kept, hence not detrimental. *Local lenders and insurance companies lend only on restricted basis while FHA makes no distinction. (See next page for continuation)

15.1: Henry C. Hamilton, Pres., Mchugh-Hamilton Realtors, and HOLC contract brokers; also personal inspection by Field Agent.

areaDesc.2: Level to elevated. Principal subdivions known as Woodlawn (A-1), Beverly Hills (A-3), Du Broca Tract (A-4 ,5) and Roberts-Hunter Tract (A-6).
areaDesc.3: Proximity to $1,000,000 public high school; good transportation facilities, practically all streets paved, presence of neighborhood business center. All utilities in.
areaDesc.4: None
areaDesc.14: These 6 areas contain aobut 35 houses, practically all of which are of modern construction.

15.1: Henry C. Hamilton, Pres., Mchugh-Hamilton Realtors, and HOLC contract brokers; also personal inspection by Field Agent.

areaDesc.2: Level. Principal subdivisions known as Howell's and Tuttle's additions.
areaDesc.3: Good transportation facilities (street cars); all utlities in. Good grammer school in area. All streets paved.
areaDesc.4: Heavy passing asessments now in process of re-adjustment. Main life of Gulf, Mobile and Northern R. R. runs long southern boundary of area.
areaDesc.14: *Ample mortgage funds are available in this area but on a restricted basis; in other words, smaller percentages of the appraised value will be lent than is the case in the A and B areas.

15.1: Henry C. Hamilton, Pres., Mchugh-Hamilton Realtors, and HOLC contract brokers; also personal inspection by Field Agent.

C3.name: Davis and Cates, Rapier Tract etc.

areaDesc.2: Level. Principal subdivision known as Davis and Cates, Rapier TRact, McPhilipps and Gordon's.
areaDesc.3: All utilities in. Proximity to city. Good schools and churches.
areaDesc.4: About 75% of the streets are paved. Absence of strictly enforced zoning ordinacne. Heavy paving assessments now in the process of adjustment.

5.a: Mixed: Business and professional. Clerical and factory workers

areaDesc.14: The wide variation of family income, sales and rental values within this area is due to the location of some of the city's finest homes, which belong to wealthy individuals, along both sides of Government Street within this area. *All lender will lend only on a restricted basis. (See next page for continuation.)

15.1: Henry C. Hamilton, Pres., Mchugh-Hamilton Realtors, and HOLC contract brokers; also personal inspection by Field Agent.

areaDesc.2: Level with some rolling. Principal subdivisions known as Park Terrace (B-3), Carlin Street East (B-4), Silverwood (B-5), Fearn Way (B-6), Blacklawn (B-7), and Westwood-Homewood Section (B-8).
areaDesc.3: Good transportation facilities. Near public high school, grammer schools, and Memorial Park. All utilities in.
areaDesc.4: None

5.a: Young business, clerical  and professional men

areaDesc.13: Static for next 5 years, then probably slowly downward with age of buildings
areaDesc.14: These six areas contain about 175 houses. In the eastern portion of B-3 along the western side of Monterey Street to Lamar Street, there is an older type of property which is in poorer repair condition than that of the remainder of the section. (Should be given C rating).

6.b: Frame - 50%; brick veneer and hollow tile 50%
